greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row 0 is 1; for n>0, row n gives 1^n, prime(1)^n, prime(2)^n, ..., prime(n)^n.
comment: Polynomials like x^2+2^2*x+3^2 and x^4+2^4+x^3+3^4*x^2+5^4*x+7^4 inspired this sequence.
mathematica: T[n_, m_] := If[n == 0, 1,Prime[n]^m] a = Table[Table[T[n, m], {n, 0, m}], {m, 0, 10}] b = Flatten[a] MatrixForm[a]
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Jun 24 2006
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 26 2007
